metadata.synopsis: Isobel is hanging out in MOO after the defeat of Ketheric. If NS is alive, this dialogue will follow their reunion. She is glad Ketheric is dead and does exposition about her story with her father/ Nightsong. At the end she may join your camp.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Run oe SCE_SetupDebrief2. Run teleport S_HAV_Isobel3. Talk to IsobelOR1. Run oe fullcamp

83.speaker: Isobel
83.text: I hope Aylin's all right. Can't wait to have her in my arms again...
83.context: NodeContext: Kidding, but she's not a natural jokester so she's a little awkward

96.speaker: Isobel
96.context: NodeContext: Kidding, but she's not a natural jokester so she's a little awkward

31.speaker: Player
31.text: What will you do now that your father's gone?
31.context: NodeContext: Kidding, but she's not a natural jokester so she's a little awkward

112.speaker: Isobel
112.text: Oh, I don't know. Change my hair colour. Buy a horse.
112.context: NodeContext: Kidding, but she's not a natural jokester so she's a little awkward

38.speaker: Isobel
38.text: In seriousness, I intend to help you fight the Absolute - what lies behind the Absolute, that is.

147.speaker: Isobel
147.text: None of us will be safe until that looming horror is defeated. When the time comes, I'll fight at your side.

18.speaker: Isobel
18.text: In seriousness, my home needs me. It's still enveloped in Shar's horrific curse. If it can be cleansed, I'll find a way.

4.speaker: Isobel
4.text: But I admit that plays second fiddle to helping you. None of us will be safe until the horror behind 'the Absolute' is defeated. When the time comes, I'll fight at your side.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: What will you do now that your father's gone?

39.speaker: Isobel
39.text: Look after my angel, of course. She's been through more than I can bear to think about.

123.speaker: Isobel
123.text: A hundred years in the Shadowfell. A hundred years being murdered by Sharrans over and over. It fills me with a rage I can hardly contain.

12.speaker: Isobel
12.text: She's a formidable woman, my Aylin, but no one could escape such horrors unscathed. She's in my hands, now, and I intend to help her through whatever's to come.

73.speaker: Isobel
73.text: We'll both of us stand by you when the time comes to put down the horror that threatens this city. We are your allies for life.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Tell me again about what happened between you and your father Ketheric.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I'd like to know what happened between you and your father Ketheric.

143.speaker: Isobel
143.text: He told me we'd be together now, said Aylin was dead. I couldn't speak. Could only run.

139.speaker: Isobel
139.text: By the time Jaheira came, I'd pieced together just enough to know I'd been dead a hundred years. That my father was the source of the horrors that plagued my home.

125.speaker: Isobel
125.text: He's gone now. But I suppose the man I knew died when I died. The man he became - that wasn't the father I knew. The one I loved so very much.

97.speaker: Isobel
97.text: You did it - you killed him. Ketheric Thorm. My... my father.
97.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

40.speaker: Player
40.text: It seems there's a great deal you haven't told me.

66.speaker: Isobel
66.text: There is. But perhaps it's time you knew the entire truth.

109.speaker: Isobel
109.text: As you know, Ketheric Thorm is - was - my father.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: So you're Ketheric's daughter. Where were you while he was amassing an army for the Absolute?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You really claim to be unaware of his doings?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Why did you lie about who you are?

127.speaker: Isobel
127.text: I had a safe haven - it was my duty to protect the people at Last Light. If I'd told them I was the daughter of Ketheric Thorm, they might've taken their chances in the darkness.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Are you like him? A Myrkulite?

23.speaker: Isobel
23.text: On my life, I wouldn't go near magic so vile.

107.speaker: Isobel
107.text: Looking forward to a bit of rest, if I'm honest. It's been a long century.
107.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

120.speaker: Isobel
120.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

122.speaker: Isobel
122.text: You did it - you killed him. Ketheric Thorm. My... my father.
122.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

129.speaker: Isobel
129.text: I can't believe it. I can't believe Aylin is here.
129.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

91.speaker: Isobel
91.text: And my father... I heard what happened - what he'd become.
91.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

69.speaker: Isobel
69.text: By killing him, you set him free. You set Aylin free. And me.
69.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

43.speaker: Player
43.text: So you're Ketheric's daughter. Where were you while he was amassing an army for the Absolute?
43.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

137.speaker: Isobel
137.text: I had no idea what he'd become until it was too late. I fled from him when I found out - kept a sanctuary in the shadows, where I met Jaheira.

64.speaker: Isobel
64.text: Without you, we'd be there still. My father fell so far from light, the shadow of him nearly swallowed us all whole.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: You and Aylin seem to have a lot of history. What happened?

90.speaker: Isobel
90.text: My father raised me to serve Selûne, as my mother, rest her soul, had wished. He was everything to me, all my life.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You really claim to be unaware of his doings?

70.speaker: Isobel
70.text: It's... a long story. But I'll tell it - you deserve to know.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You and Aylin seem to have a lot of history. What happened?
13.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

10.speaker: Isobel
10.text: A great deal, but still some of the details elude me.
10.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

9.speaker: Isobel
9.text: Ketheric Thorm is - was - my father.
9.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

133.speaker: Isobel
133.text: He raised me to serve Selûne, as my mother, rest her soul, had wished. He was everything to me, all my life.
133.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

5.speaker: Isobel
5.text: When an emissary of Selûne came to our little town, we were elated. Dame Aylin. Daughter of the Moonmaiden herself.
5.context: NodeContext: with a hint of awe

65.speaker: Isobel
65.text: Tell me, do you believe in love at first sight?
65.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Certainly. There's magic in a look.
145.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

94.speaker: Isobel
94.text: That's exactly it. And I tell you, I took one look at her, and I just knew. She was it.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I certainly believe you were starstruck, at least.
52.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

136.speaker: Isobel
136.text: You sound like my father. But it was more than that. This was no mere attraction - it was love.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: No, but it sounds like you do.
20.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

54.speaker: Isobel
54.text: Guilty. The moment I looked at Aylin, I just knew I had to be with her. I was hers. That was it.
54.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

56.speaker: Isobel
56.text: Lucky for me, she felt the same way. But my father was sceptical. Aylin is immortal, after all.
56.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

105.speaker: Isobel
105.text: I understand it's... strange. There's an imbalance between us, certainly. But I suppose loving Aylin felt the same as loving myself. It was natural.
105.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

42.speaker: Isobel
42.text: Then - and this is where I still need answers - I died. I'm not sure how. Why. But all was black, black, black.
42.context: NodeContext: Hesitatntly, still trying to figure things out

118.speaker: Isobel
118.text: Next I knew, I was being jolted awake. I smelled musty air. I saw shadows. And then my father's face, so changed, so hideously warped.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: He'd become the Chosen of Myrkul.

111.speaker: Isobel
111.text: I didn't know that then. But I could see the change in him. He told me we'd be together now, said Aylin was dead. I couldn't speak. Could only run.

3.speaker: Isobel
3.text: I found Last Light within the shadows. Made a shelter there. Prayed my father wouldn't find me.

24.speaker: Isobel
24.text: By the time Jaheira came, I'd pieced together just enough to know I'd been dead a hundred years. That my father was the source of the horrors plaguing this land - my home.

2.speaker: Isobel
2.text: I couldn't tell her who I was. I had to protect them - and myself - no matter what.

110.speaker: Isobel
110.text: It's all out in the open now. And with my father dead, I have nothing to fear. Except for Aylin. She needs healing. Rest.

67.speaker: Isobel
67.text: I'm grateful for your help - your friendship. I hope we won't intrude on your hospitality too long, but I'm grateful for a safe place to... well, just to be.

71.speaker: Isobel
71.text: It's all out in the open now. And with my father dead, I have nothing to fear. Only his wicked legacy to undo.

7.speaker: Isobel
7.text: Perhaps there's something I can do to help the fight against the Dead Three. The moon is rather good at illuminating darkness, after all.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: So you lied about who you were.

27.speaker: Isobel
27.text: I did. Who would trust the next-of-kin of Ketheric Thorm? But I have no more secrets.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Only a monster would rip his own daughter from the grave.

29.speaker: Isobel
29.text: And a monster he'd become. A Myrkulite.

11.speaker: Isobel
11.text: You jest, yet he did seem a ghost to me. A shadow of the father I loved. He resurrected me with magic so foul I nearly retch just thinking of it.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Ketheric captured her and was using her to fuel his invulnerability. She was called the 'Nightsong'.

58.speaker: Isobel
58.text: She... what?! Does this mean she's still alive? I've got to find her - set her free! Tell me everything you know. Please.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: It's too late for that. I killed her.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: It's too late for that. We killed her.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: It's too late for that. She was dead when I found her.

106.speaker: Isobel
106.text: My father said she was gone. I'd tried to make my peace with it. But... she was so special. So very dear.

128.speaker: Isobel
128.text: My father said she was gone. I'd tried to make my peace with it. But... she was so special. So very dear.

119.speaker: Isobel
119.text: When we met, it was like a lightning strike. My father wasn't sure about us - she was immortal, after all - but I never doubted.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Give me your map. I'll show you where she's being kept.

88.speaker: Isobel
88.text: Thank you - thank you so much. I'll gather some supplies and head out shortly. Aylin... I can't believe she's alive. Before the day's end, I'll have her in my arms. Incredible.

102.speaker: Isobel
102.text: Thank you - thank you so much. I'll gather some supplies and head out shortly. Aylin... I can't believe she's alive. Before the day's end, I'll have her in my arms. Incredible.

33.text: You're lying. She can't be saved, can she? My father told me she was... gone. It's true, isn't it?

149.speaker: Isobel
149.text: You're lying. She can't be saved, can she? My father told me she was... gone. It's true, isn't it?

19.speaker: Isobel
19.text: Why would you lie? What's the matter with you?

35.speaker: Isobel
35.text: As I was saying, I fell in love with Aylin swiftly. It was as easy as breathing.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: That's what Ketheric and his chums called her. Killed her myself.

0.speaker: Isobel
0.text: You what?! But she was immortal. How could she... how could you...?

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It was the only way to make Ketheric vulnerable.

144.speaker: Isobel
144.text: Was it? Was it truly? I don't believe that. Not for a second.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Shar got the better of me. It won't happen again.

81.speaker: Isobel
81.text: Oh it won't? Then I suppose we'll just forget this little misstep, file it under 'lessons learned'?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: It was a mistake. One I bitterly regret.

37.speaker: Isobel
37.text: I should hope so. I can't imagine what insane course of thought led you to murder someone so dear.

41.speaker: Isobel
41.text: Get out of my sight before I do something you'll regret.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: When the Lady of Loss speaks, her faithful act on her behalf.

132.speaker: Isobel
132.text: You're disgusting. You've killed someone so precious, so good. I knew Shar was wicked. But I'd hoped for better from you.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I couldn't hold my companion back. She had a mission to fulfil.

45.speaker: Isobel
45.text: A mission? A mission?! That Sharran murderer destroyed someone so precious, so good...

114.speaker: Isobel
114.text: You what?! But she was immortal. How could she... how could you...? She is the Moonmaiden's daughter. And you call yourself a Selûnite?!

84.speaker: Player
84.text: That's what Ketheric and his chums called her. We killed her.

55.speaker: Isobel
55.text: This was different. It was like I could see my fate in her eyes.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I feel there's a great deal you haven't told me.

32.speaker: Isobel
32.text: Not on purpose. Or not with the intent to deceive. I've been trying to make sense of it all.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Aren't you at all sad about your father's fate?

99.speaker: Isobel
99.text: I mourn the man I knew. He was... wonderful.

130.speaker: Isobel
130.text: I wish Aylin would be more careful. I couldn't bear to lose her again.

22.speaker: Isobel
22.text: I know you'll look out for her. You will, right? Of course you will.
